XdxfrVJTpQ6cbYT394xngQ.text: I know there are tons and tons of new innovative burger joints in the Phoenix area. Harvey's Wineburgers never lets us down since 2009.  We continuously are never disappointed with the food or the service.  Freshly made burgers that are always thick and very, very juicy and the best burger by far, I think, here in town. The toppings to the burgers are always fresh.  No unripe or end tomatoes here. The bartenders and service have never disappointed us either. Mark is a great bartender!  He is always friendly.  Our favorite thing isnt even the burger, it's the onion rings!  I have always tried to figure out their sweet batter, but they are always perfect and a unique sweet flavor and freshly cut!  And yes, they are the best in town too!  They have several appetizers and other sandwiches that won't let you down.  What I love is its not  Scottsdale ridiculous prices for a burger.  So affordable that you dont have to worry about breaking your bank.  Dinner for two and a few pitchers of beers and shots and my wife's hard drinks, all for under $40.00.  You really can't beat that. Plenty of tvs, great music, and not a bad bar length if you like a bar to sit at and talk.

photos.caption: Photo of Harvey's Wineburger - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bomb diggety cheese wine burger with onion rings.  That is one patty!  The deluxe comes with two patties!

HprhGTukmvECgyrcA8VU5g.text: The waitress was nice, but we waited forever for mediocre food. There were maybe 12 people in the place, by no means busy, and it took 45 minutes to get our food. After half an hour, our waitress offered us fries and apologized saying the food was "taking longer than normal". Once we got our burgers, we were underwhelmed. My burger was served on a cheap bun and my gal's patty was falling apart. We took our food to go and left. Maybe 10 minutes after we finished our food at home, my girlfriend was sick. Probably caught them on a bad day, but we probably won't be back.

MWf9p7-ogJxLmtsLID3Nag.text: The new owner nothing but class. He asked me to move my car that was parked next to the handicapped my fault but then he offered to watch my car if I were to move in the back what a great guy everything is good here you should come here for a $5 special every day of the week it is awesome

WhlsgV2mklXxdR_DAUUA1w.text: The best burgers in town and the best service in town. Go once and it will be a wkly spot if not daily !!!! Our office gets take out wkly anywheres from 4 to 14 orders at once and they are always spot on, excellent and delicious every time, thank you!!!

SQwc-m0axaZbnS7pbzFiYQ.text: Do not let appearances fool you. Yes, it is a divey looking bar, but they have delicious food and for a decent price!!! I ordered the chicken strips which came with fries. The chicken had a really nice crunchy outside and the inside was super juicy. My bf ordered the garlic parmesan patty melt. The patty's are all made with a little bit of red wine. I wasn't sure if I could taste the wine or not but it was delicious either way. The patty melt had a garlic parmesan sauce on it with bacon, onions, and grilled mushrooms. The mushrooms were strange. They had really good flavor but we're a little rubbery in texture. I wasn't really sure what that was about. However, eating the patty melt as a complete sandwich with everything in a bite was great! I felt like it tasted like it should sit really heavy in my stomach but it didn't and that was a nice surprise. They have food specials Monday through Friday and happy hour 3-6.

tjeitzfO_6rNMeZLtFfp2Q.text: I think this is one of the best burgers you can get, anywhere.  Wine in your food is already the best idea of all time. Why not pour wine all over your burger while it cooks on the griddle?  This place is a classic Phoenix bar: established in 1950-something or whatever... in other words: it has been around for a while, so it must be good.

DpeqQkqmA-6I3k4BYtBdpQ.text: Its a local bar for sure. Only shock top and bud light on draft. They do have bottles of other stuff but you can drink bottles at home. I've had the patty melt and cheeseburger and both were exceptional. they don't give you enough fries with your burger. The daily specials are pretty good. Nice service and friendly people. Definitely 90% locals in there.

NdiKZAkhxb3Gka6KHZBbog.text: The very definition of a dive bar w a food problem. They won best take out for good reason. Don't need a menu just get a burger you can't go wrong. Love this place.

l3Hj4p8l4y96CfdDfVckWQ.text: This place is a throwback dive and I love it. The burger is of great size for the price. The bar staff is super friendly and you don't feel guilty for having a beer at 11 AM there cause you are not the only one. I frequent this place usually after a round of golf for a nice cold beer and burger and has now become somewhat of a tradition. Do not let the outside fool you.

sUL83jTkrOdqHxm3xs9G_w.text: The food is delicious! The staff is great but the crowd is kinda rough. Some older women finished our game of pool while we were eating (she was by herself), when we gently asked her if she was done using the table, she said we could play her for it on our dime. Ha! Some guy had bought us shots before my friends boyfriend showed up and he continued to stare at us and whisper as the night went on. The old man playing the table next to us was very drunk and kind of aggressive, loud, and inconsiderate. He was constantly in our space. Just regular bar sleaze, would definitely take the food to go next time.

NS-jO9KVc8ZjdxvsiUV6ZQ.text: Some people go to McDonalds at midnight after a night out. But I make my way to the best juke box joint with the best burgers in town! Stupid good!

photos.caption: Photo of Harvey's Wineburger - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sipping while waiting on deliciousness!
Photo of Harvey's Wineburger - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Onion rings
Photo of Harvey's Wineburger - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Double cheddar cheeseburger with grilled mushrooms and onions.

N4ea-xqXpRhmdUg64oNwsw.text: Burgers don't get any better than this. When I got to Phoenix, everyone said that Harvey's Wineburgers are the best in town, and I agree. You don't come here for ambiance, you come here for good food. Be sure to try the onion rings!

h9SN_e1A3BHPzfgBRysT4g.text: I'm in love with this place! The food is amazing for sure. They have my favorite bourbon, Bulliet, on special on fridays. They play amazing music as well! They crowd is always very eclectic and the bartenders are attentive and very nice. I'm so happy I have found such an awesome local place!

ZZSKUV9rCcRfinl0cm1d6w.text: Oh man, this is a dive bar at it's finest.  Total divey joint and a little sketch looking from the outside. This was a hangout of a friend's grandpa back in the day, and I'm pretty sure it's still the same decor FROM back in the day. You walk in, it's totally dark inside so it could be noon or 2 am in there, ya never know.  But we came for the cheeseburgers because we'd heard how fantastic they were.  They were.  Handmade juicy burgers chargrilled.  Toasted buns. Oh man.  Perfectly cooked fries. You get a boatload of fries/onion rings so order one basket because 3 of us shared.    You want some great people watching and an amazing burger?  For cheap?  Come here.

LVkkBp7zDIPNGi1Q89wn6w.text: Great place. Food was fresh, bartender was on top of it. What more can you ask for!?!

uoogIm15DCkUUjIdQjwmPA.text: Decent burgers here.  Didn't live up to the hype, though.  One thing that concerned me was the gal cooking the burgers had long hair that was not tied back.  Just an FYI in case you're squeamish about plucking hair out of your food.

5FIuR7l4lzyqOWJPbAvqkQ.text: Such a great staff, & great service. Food so hot it makes you wanna eat it and say, f*ck my tongue.. This shit is good!" I love this place and love coming here. Please try and come soon!!! Sidenote: Shawn the handsome man that served us DID NOT MAKE MY EYES HURT!! Wink... ; ) Eric can cook his ass off!!! You my think it's easy serving the masses but it takes the skill that he possesses!

photos.caption: Photo of Harvey's Wineburger - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Eric making my chicken strips... I know, I know I say &#34;chicken strips whatever..&#34; But I have to say these r hands down the best!

3TEc8QI7_uKFEIRlebYJkQ.text: A great Phoenician restaurant. Pretty simple: fried fare and alcohol. If you want quinoa, a spritzer, or some light fare at ridiculous prices while hanging with your Club of Dandies- this ain't for you.

9u0xBfBILnwGuoYVVtNMrg.text: It was a pretty good two hours killed here on a Sunday afternoon. Looked like a good majority of the regulars were on hand including one guy who claimed 35 years drinking at this establishment. It was dark inside, but they have some decent TV sets and most channels as well. It is a well dated place, but that usually means a good grill. I had to order the original for $7 and it was a good solid burger. Kept it simple with just grilled onions and watched the chef pour the signature wine, but you can't taste the wine. The fries were clearly old and stale tasting, but the friendly people and burger make it worth a return visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Harvey's Wineburger - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sunday burger

RR016JlB97u0RSCJvthDMQ.text: This place has been around for many years in the Phoenix area. Interesting take on burgers. Tasty and juicy. A divey atmosphere but that is part of this places charm

ZA76sVeiMZaFr_RppaOiZw.text: Hubby and I were craving wings.  Omg Leo the chef rocked the wings and fries. Bonus: daily special PBR and a shot for $3.75 BONUS!!!  Desiree, the Bartendor is super nice, funny and attentive!

photos.caption: Photo of Harvey's Wineburger - Phoenix, AZ, United States

ku7QelvlxH6CZVLtE0QBOw.text: Love this place. It never disappoints. Whether picking up burgers for the work crew,  or eating in. The burgers and wait staff are the best!

FQw6lKT-wnHShiyzl3rv3w.text: This place has the best service ever!!! They can be packed with only two employees working and still have your drinks full at all times. They also have cheap shots and always have drink specials. They really care about their customers and always provide exceptional service. Their food is soooo good too! They are by far the best bar in Phoenix.

T-mRcaVs_eaG-K2abCqhIg.text: This is horrible place to go  if your are Asian!! They even serving you forever!!!! Terrible  server and service ever!@

MSr3Ryb5qcfEK-CrKNsGOQ.text: My favorite bar in Phoenix. I'm not from Arizona but this place always feels like being around family. Marc, Leo, and Patty treat everyone with respect and friendship. This place is a gem. I appreciate you guys more than you know! Thanks for the good times!   P.S Burgers are amazing. I don't even like burgers and I crave them.

W5NKvYNgkMfLuSI7z95szA.text: So so good! Some the best wings I have ever had, garlic Parmesan and medium sauce combo. Not on the menu, but ask for it and try the best sauce combination on wings ever. Dive bar vibes, with friendly staff and great food.

R9QfNMLka3pzUvCgMOY6kQ.text: Little hole in the wall bar WITH great goddamn burgers!!!! Had the Mushroom Burger and it melted in my mouth, was really impressed with their burgers! All in all I will definitely be going back.

x1hRPakCaYsRVmZb2TgZ7A.text: Ok, I can only speak about the burgers. Table for five and all of us thought the consistency of the beef was very strange. No-one thought they were any better than a fast food chain. Nothing to fuss about at all.

cSBhBwaOGGoCm3320UTsbg.text: My first time in this place and I definitely will not be returning. I walked in at 4:35 and sat at the bar. Was never greeted and after 5 minutes I addressed the bartender whose been in front of me the whole time. She responded with, yeah. I ordered and waited 20 and I noticed no one was cooking. I asked about my order, and it was only started after I complained. She responded with; I just put the order in ( as if to say it's not my job) I waited 40 more minutes. I saw my order was done and waited 5 minutes after she rang the bell. I had to request to have my order from the cook directly. The bartender was rude, un applogetic, and pushy. As a first time customer I would not return.  It was apparent the employees were unhappy and overworked. I should not have to take attitude from the whole staff.

NUmbwTLvK-bLYuQoYL1KUg.text: BEST DIVE BAR IN PHOENIX! Chef Leo and Mark were hospitable and, not to be outdone, they KNOWS what the people want. JUICY FUGGIN BURGERS and a SOLID COCKTAIL. If you want a low key, high class time, this is the place. Whether you're here for the burgers or the Joe Dirt reference, (guilty), this is the place to go. Period.

2m8OKNCMcMcgpIdxqLN9UQ.text: This place is always so great! Classic burger on a flat top, great service, low lights dive bar that is really cool! Melissa was awesome behind the bar and Patty is so great on the grill!  Real food, real people, Merica!

cu4ks_XmWuqySQSUImBN1A.text: I've driving and walked passed this place too many times saying "I gotta check this spot out." Well, that faithful day was today, and boy am i happy!! This spot is the premier location for simply good shit. ALL MY BURGERS FROM HERE ON OUT WILL BE OUTTA HARVEY's Also..be sure to ask Mark to wiggle for you--he does it well

akbtV3nLcQijns5hVVwPtQ.text: Mal was so welcoming and bite eyed we didn't want to leave.  Thanks for a very pleasant surprise.

EM4n-YbZGuAAQHL8EJfNWA.text: This place is fun! Went here in the late evening on a week day with a friend who lives nearby. They play music (and sometimes everyone sings along!). Burgers are excellent. I ordered a protein style burger that I split with a friend. They actually brought it out separate for us along with the fries. Drinks were delicious. Service was speedy. Also, they have a yelp check in special! Can't wait to come back again.

4ik9VJ7gq0hUMyJ3txyH9Q.text: Never, never would I walk into a place like this unless A. I wanted an experience that I haven't had in several decades; B. I wanted a hamburger; C. My friends made me do it.  A. Wrong answer. This is a bar. There are reasons why people visit bars. If that's what you are looking for, then this place would be fine, I think. Check the other reviews for that answer though.   B. Wrong answer. The wine hamburger was tasty and the fries hit the spot. The meat tasted fresh and mine was cooked through. I noticed pink in my hubby's meat (which is the way he likes his). I like mine well cooked, so I asked if when the burgers where ordered, if he had specified how we wanted the burgers cooked. The answer was no. Score. Unless I just couldn't see the color of my meat because of the lighting. Scary.  C. Correct. Sometimes when you are with a group of people, you just go with the flow, particularly when you are with people in their late 20s. However, when my husband and I were challenged to a game of pool at one of the two tables, the place scored some stars.

5A4TSwXEBH52SgjcyTySOQ.text: If you're in the mood for a dive bar with a really good burger and probably some of the best onion rings in the valley... this is the place to visit. Can't give it 5 stars because the bathrooms are absolutely repulsive, even for a dive bar.

2vkUnu0m-aYQG8PVVRqfMw.text: This place is dirty.  Food is awful, transients hang out here, music is Loud & noisy. When we were going here there was a couple making out on the outside of a building. Will never go back

MbCBF8QfH61V0z7TsBCLXg.text: Great burger and fries...for a bar this place had some awesome food.  Kinda load, but it's a bar.  Service was friendly and on point.  Will be back for sure.

6Y7aGgLVeYZ7zJV3mMCT4Q.text: After a late night concert... we were hungry and wondering where we should go for drinks and food.  We've been here for day drinking and it's amazing..... but never did the late night.  Well we were so pleased to be served by Mark and of course had the best burgers in town!!  We'll be back again soon!!

YtXWvlD6Zbgpz94DjZ0XOA.text: Delicious burger and fries, cheap beer, chill atmosphere...doesn't get much better. Monty, Friday-Sunday grillmaster, is the shiz.

photos.caption: Photo of Harvey's Wineburger - Phoenix, AZ, United States

hfJWM3qE9kMfGo5wCy3kgw.text: This gets a 5 Star Dive Bar rating because it excels at things that make dive bars great:  1. Cheap booze.  2. Great food. Also cheap. Go for the burgers.  3. Jukebox with a solid 70s, 80s, and 90's selection.  4. Games. Pool, darts, and a vintage bowling arcade.

MPzfY9_VGWj2u-9_4itc8A.text: I am a dive bar expert.  I love me a good dive bar.  The darker and older the better.  The surly regulars on the fringes of society are my people.  This place is shit.  Not 'The Shit'.  Actual shit, as in a piece of crap.  We ordered wings, after the bartender bragged how they were the best in town, and the regulars started laughing about how they just cooked a bunch of fish they caught locally in the frier, and that our wings were gonna taste fishy.  Not in a "we're fuckin' with you" way, but more of a "we have no sense of self" way.  Homo say what!?!?  They did taste fishy!  We each ate only one.  Everyone was having a great time about it.  We left an entire plate of uneaten wings, and nobody gave a shit.  Fine, no problem.    We finished our beers and left.  Even if the wings weren't trouty, they were way too big.  Bigger isn't better in the case of wings.  They aren't actually buffalo wings, and shouldnt resemble some bloated and abused fictional beast.  They should be from chickens.  SMALL CREATURES CALLED CHICKENS.  The end.

qkP2BdjyvGbC7-ylB6CT6g.text: I've passed this place hundreds of times, and finally came here for dinner on a Saturday evening.  This place is an unapologetic dive with a unique charm.  They do have a fun "game room" with a pool table and other bar games.  The menu is fairly limited to burgers, fries, and other traditional bar fare.  They also only have two beers on tap, Bud and Bud Light.    I ordered the 1/3 lb. wineburger and a side of fries.  The burger was tasty but nothing to rave about.  They served a generous portion of fries, which, like the burger, were good but not outstanding.  Surprisingly the service was excellent, which may be due to it being a slow night.  The server/bartender/cook was very attentive, asked about the burger, made sure I always had a drink, and even repositioned the TV so I can better watch a preseason game.    Overall, it was a good experience (3.5 stars if Yelp allowed halves).  The food is good (between quality fast-food and a trendy restaurant), the prices are more than reasonable, and the service was great.  If I go back, I would definitely try the 2/3 lb. burgers, which looked like a better choice.

OM6S_XKwogGy6rTH7D1MOw.text: Burgers are good, and enjoyable with a beer. And there fries... plus getting a car wash next door while this takes place is even more worth while.

PgkyxJ1gdYjAd5BsSQscEA.text: Just plain cheap simple greasy food.  The best a "Hole in the wall" can be. Excellent atmosphere. Love this place and will continue to frequent.

0j6qnG_IBUWDEYHWDUS4bQ.text: Kind of a depressing dive bar - not really my kind of hangout.  If I liked the burger, I'd recommend only ordering it to go.  I went with a patty melt, and was not impressed.  The whole cooking with wine concept may seem like a good idea, and it does make for a slightly interesting flavor, but I wouldn't call it good.  Aside from the wine flavor, the meat wasn't very good anyway, just like the other fixins and the fries.  Combined with the atmosphere and general grungy feeling (I don't know how sanitary the place is, but I wouldn't bet on it passing inspection), I definitely won't be back.

ZjYs8pUdO_77256iYiG77w.text: This place is great! The staff is very friendly & the food is great for the price. Not to mention awesome drink specials ($3 for Grey Goose anyone?), and the bartender pours with a heavy hand.  Very eclectic music and fun arcade games, though we didn't play any. Being it a dive bar, I had my reservations of the clientele in the place, but when we all joined in for a group rendition of some 80s love songs, I knew it was all good.

SeRA4etmxqmH7n3xRx0VLQ.text: awesome burgers.  decent service.  good atmosphere.  it's a dive bar.  just fyi.  with good food.

Vz7g2k97SU2VzVz49Xl4hg.text: Based on Chad L's November 2013 review, I returned to Harvey's in March 2014 with a couple of friends.  Chad's report is correct, they have gone back to using the quality beef that kept them in business 40 years.  The sandwich is still a little smaller than the old days, but the burger is clearly hand made and absolutely delicious.  We are still debating whether you can taste the wine in the wine burger, that might require another visit or two.  They now offer a reasonably-priced lunch 'combo' that gives you great French fries (or their fabulous onion rings) with your burger in just enough quantity that you can finish them.  The table service is quick and as friendly as always. I will now put Harvey's back on my list of favorite (under $8) burger places in Phoenix.  Thank goodness for the new owners who have brought back tradition. You can't buy that "homey" feel elsewhere.

vbmxWHr0PiHsjUS9Ff2K_A.text: Went for lunch during my break, awesome food. Surprisingly good for a hole in the wall dive bar. They have great lunch specials and listening to the drunk locals is always entertaining.

fnkOTDTrshMokzlYjxNN0Q.text: That old bar smell.  This goes way beyond dive bar.  I commented to my friend about the couple on barstools, 'those two are "leaving las vegas'!"     Does any establishment need 40 taped up signs warning the would-be patron of their rules:  "NO CREDIT CARDS" --and someone wrote by hand, 'EVER'.  and "NO GUNS" and multiple "NO SMOKING"   I ate the burger and I lived, though the meat tasted old I figured it was soooooo overly cooked that I probably was safe.  ...Jesus!  I just read the review about them having cooler "problems".

2s8T6AMrAZI4McPMC8hZMA.text: Don't let the looks fool you, the grill is great here. The Reuben is as good as any I've had. I like it here to get out of the bright desert heat and have a cold draft to cool my heels for a few. The specialty is the Weinburger grilled 'ground chuck soaked in wine' on an ample bun. They've been around for a long time for a reason; lots of personality.

photos.caption: Photo of Harvey's Wineburger - Phoenix, AZ, United States

b4N2cQkVqI9eSa9tVJdPcw.text: $30 for two cheeseburgers, two draft beers , a bottle of coors and a rum/ coke is too much. In these hard times, it's ridiculous to not mention to the customer that fries are extra and will cost $6 on top of the $6 each for a burger. The burger was real good, but not worth $6 and it has shrunk. The order of fries was $6 and not worth it at all. I shouldn't have stopped, even though traffic was bad, I could have taken my wife to The Armadillo Grill for 5 star food / experience at this price, just across the street or gone to Aunt Chilladas and spent it on drinks and had free happy hour Mexican food. The girl didn't even mention the fries were an extra $6  !!! Come on ! I feel raped !

k99yksDoBun-Iw3FbSX4yA.text: Recommended by a co-worker, and out looking for some grub I decided it was worth a shot.  Definitely a dive as described, but reasonably full so I stayed.  The service was a little slow, and the food kind of blah, but the cheese wineburger was decent if bland.  The chili cheese fries came out on a huge plate and the fries were not great, the chili tasted like it came from a can, but the cheese and onions were real and fresh.  I didn't realize it was RC Cola, which I did not enjoy, but the price was good and it was an interesting place to sit and people watch.  /overheard "I don't do anything downstairs!"

LoAqA5YnRUnvZj9N2tPjLw.text: Been there a ton of times over the past 30 years. Same great burgers and fries, people, choice of bud and bud lite...  Its a dive. Great place to go for lunch but maybe not the best place to impress the ladies. 8)

MMLEqlYgIKq55CBt21-CtQ.text: Yes, it's a dive bar. But it's one of the most interesting dive bars I've ever been to. They only have 2 beers on draft, and only about 10 items on the menu. But it's just such an interesting place to hang out and play pool, darts, pinball, or the old bowling machine. The staff are always very friendly (although some are a bit more wild and crazy than others). All in all, the best dive in Phoenix.

TM4d_68VPMMmOi9rE-IEpg.text: Yup, I'm a fan!!  Seriously, how have I never been here.  My friend used to live in the area and she told me about 6-7 years ago that this place was good.  It just looks kinda scary from the outside.  I mean I felt like once I walked in, the music would stop and everyone would look at me.  I climbed that mountain and finally visited with the BF last Friday.  We almost turned away because we didn't have cash on us, and didn't feel like hitting the ATM inside, I mean we got back in the car, talked for a second and then said what the heck!    Walked in to a tiny little place with a LONG bar!  There were probably 4 people at the bar, and 3 people in the game room playing pool.  They had the classic MLB game on, it was like Blue Jays and Astros, funny uniforms! It was maybe 2pm.  So the bartender says, What can I get for you?  My dumbazz says "Can I see a menu", this is where the music would have stopped.  WHOOPSY, there really isn't a menu, its kind of like a snack bar, where you look up, make your choice and its done.  Burger or Dog, Fries, Onion Rings or both!! DUH!  The bartender was nice though, I wanted draft the BF wanted bottle so he suggested I get a small pitcher, it's the cheapest way to go...SOLD! Don't have to pull my leg, thats for sure!    So, I ordered the cheeseburger, and the BF orders the gigantic chili burger, which was reduced to the smaller one by recommendation of the friendly bartender. BF sort of put up a fight, but the bartender assured him it would be plenty and if not, the next one was on him.  This turned out to be plenty for him, and I was thankful too, we had a long night ahead of us.  Much to our surprise, although I'm not sure what else we were thinking, bartender grabs a handful of meat slaps it on the flat top smooshes it down, and thus our burgers were born and cooking.  I mean, for real?  Man it was soo good, greasy yes, but everything a burger should be!  The last bite of course was the best, it had me looking for my other half, since I always cut those suckers in half.  I don't eat burgers often, but I can't wait to take my dad here, I might have finally found one place in town he's never been too.  While we were finishing up, a couple came in and sat next to us, who appeared to have just finished a golf game.  They ordered shots of Patron, I don't know how we got out without doing one with them.  The lady on the other side of us was getting her car washed next door so she said she comes in every time.  It was funny because the guy next to her, was hitting on her, and instead of asking her what she did for a living he asked her what her talents were!!  FUNNIEST thing ever!  Anyway, great place, great dive bar atmosphere!  Casual is as casual does.

EAZW79uwrfJnQnG7nlPVCw.text: OK so I went with Chris T. here and here is the thing. . . I have a rule when it comes to food establishments and this place does follow suite. Most often than not the little mom and pop shop hole in the wall. . (( and this place is what I consider a "dive / hold in the wall". . )) usually have really good food.   So here is my review. And I will have to break it down into categories.   ---------Environment:**** Here's the deal. If you enjoy tennis, chess, and polo. This "aint" your spot. If you are comfortable with wobbly tables, hard chairs the sound of beer bottles tossed into a trash can .  .then keep reading.   Harvey's Wineburger reminds me of Stag's Head bar. In case you don't remember that's the name of the place on Dukes of Hazard? Ok well the waitress was no where near the same looks as daisy but she had a mom and pop shop charm about her. Smiles and jokes were readily available. Chris T. and I were rather excited about possibly finding a new "joint" to hang out at and writing a good review. I ordered the Cheese Wineburger and Chris ordered the Super Cheese Wineburger. She mentioned something about the fries and onion rings because we would get more for cheaper or something. I didn't really hear but Chris said sure and that was good enough for me.    ---------The Wait: ---------**  As we walked in the door it we found a dark bar with a grill on the left. We sat our selves hoping someone would notice. There were a couple people in there that looked like regulars chatting away about something to the line cook and I think that is what our down fall was. The food was late and the waitress right off the bat apologized as she gave us our to-go bag as we requested after franticly watching the clock. She tossed in the drinks and fries for free because of the wait.  There was a long wait for the order. I believe it was the cool jibber-jabbin to the regulars that hung up the order.   ---------The Food: --------- *****  If it came only to the food I would give this review 5 stars. The burgers were stacked high like it was going for a photo-op.  I like my fries a little crispy and thought they were perfect. I'm not into soggy fries.   I have to make a comment on the other reviews. These are the ones about the lack of hygiene comments. This is referring to one night that they were extremely understaffed on a Friday night. I have to ask you if you ever worked in a restaurant.  I hate to tell you but that is more common than you think. Even when I worked in a 4 star restaurant at a resort. Ever watch Hells Kitchen.  .yeah. . Stick your finger in my food and see if the meat is done. . Thanks. .  I have to say I have not made a final thumb up or down. Next time I go there for lunch "and I plan on going back" I will call ahead and order. My only issue with this place was the wait for the food. The staff was friendly in a down home manner.  The food was really good, and my only issue was the wait.   ---------Over all score: --------- ****  look for another review at some point. I'm not firm on this. I will have to see if the time service issue is the same next time.   Until next time. . keep the groove and be cool.  .

6gapcarD7AEbOirEEuLwUA.text: Stopped in for my post-workout bowl of Chili and pitcher of beer and was IMPRESSED! Didn't want fancy- I was in my gym clothes. If you love a dark dive with really good food and prices this place is for you... The cook was visible and very friendly as well and the bartender was cool. The ladies was acceptable. The only thing missing was a smoking patio. I'll be back!

hgnr2Sr3cACyypAyfLaJAw.text: Nobody's reviewed this place yet?? Probably because nobody knows it exists. I didn't know myself. I could barely even find the place.  What a cool divey bar/restaurant. I along with my coworkers all ordered burgers and they didn't disappoint. While not the best burger I've ever had it was moist and delicious. Apparently the burgers are saturated in Burgundy while on the grill which gives them their flavor. Fries do not come with, which is always annoying, but we ordered a mix basket with onion rings and fries and it was quite tasty.   Only down note; halfway through the meal my coworker claimed he found a long hair in his burger that he swore up and down wasn't his. Being a self-proclaimed "goat", he ate the burger anyway. I know this would warrant an immediate look of disgust and a one star rating by some....but shit happens. Hair gets in burgers. I'll give the place the benefit of the doubt.   But if you are repulsed by such things, I would encourage you to come here anyway if only to have a drink, the place is pretty cool.  Oh and they do not accept credit cards, so bring some cash if you do not want to be charged a $2 fee from the ATM offered inside.

FbuGHX3vrSVJPFRtQDbgbA.text: Our first time here. Make sure you have 40 minutes to wait for your average tasting burger. The fries tasted like they were frozen. The good 'ole boys who seemed to be regulars, were loud and disrespectful. It's your typical dark, old and average dive bar. Let's see, something positive to say... you can apparently bring your dog. Yep. Inside. Where food is being served. Awesome.

Mqpu7pyd949s3zKMf5d-IQ.text: Been here before. Was good. During middle of day. Told my wyfe "you gotta try this place" its yummy. Took her for dinner. Her cheeseburger was over cooked and dry. My wings were charred and dry. Wait staff asked how it was and i told her "overcooked". She said sorry can i make u more? I said NO cant stomach anymore of their food. So what do i get in return? A FULL BILL!!! $30..... At least the wyfe learned a new drink. Wont be back here, which sucks cause they are stumbling distance from home

rOBv97KNk3LbLwWHqWbHrg.text: This is a GREAT place to come to hit rock bottom after a long night of drinking.The first time I wound up at this place I was already plastered and someone thought it was a good idea to pop in here for "just one more". It was fun because we were messing around in the game room adjacent to the bar and dining area. They have pool and shuffleboard and this VERY old retro bowling game with plastic pins. It really was good times. They have a good jukebox and we wound up slow dancing to "Wonderful Tonight" with the smell of rancid grease in the air right as it was last call.   Not quite as enjoyable when you're sober and/or it's still daylight.  I've been back a few times and each time have thought "God, how did I end up back here???" We actually came for food and drinks one time. Against my better judgement and because no one with me cared to intervene, I ordered a chili dog. Needless to say my intestines were doing gymnastics for the next two days trying get the horrid thing out of my system.  So I strongly advise against eating here. I am by no means a healthy eater but I think I've discovered my grease threshold here at Harvey's.   Much like a trip to Walmart at Christown, I always feel a desperate need to bathe after I visit Harvey's. The drinks here however are VERY cheap. If you're short on cash and just need to knock back one or two you'd probably be OK here.

dwWJ4_13Pur8m9XedAZw3A.text: Have driven by hundreds of times and decided to check this place out while getting an oil change down the road. What an amazing place! Bartenders are wonderful and friendly. The cook is amazing. Very diverse crowd. Food is very fresh. Had a hamburger, onion rings and fried jalapenos. It was delicious! Will definitely come back. Although this place has been around forever, it is extremely clean. Would highly recommend.

0zgikU1GajORmQVUvUrpFQ.text: After eating the burger and fries I quickly decided this place will be a regular for us... Love that it's a dive bar as well .. Warning ! The burgers are very greasy but so worth it ! And the buns are grilled with a little grease too :) I usually don't eat my buns but at this place I did and will.  I'm not hungover but this is prob a really good hangover burger too !!

y3eYg-_SiavYHOMudvX-NQ.text: This place is misleading.  Wineburger is a great concept and name, but the place is nothing more than a strip mall burger joint.  Like other reviews, it's 95% bar, 5% restaurant with a cheers type atmosphere.  Went on a Wednesday night and all the TVs were on a infomercial channel.  When I asked if they could put something else on, the middle aged Persian bartender told me that the cable was out and somehow we were stuck with a P90x drone .  Another flaw, the ventilation is so poor that you smell like you actually  fried the burgers on your stovetop.  Many better places in Phoenix

wR_uJf94nvq-z-4mL7Ve2w.text: Went there for the first time since it just got sold again. BURGERS ARE BETTER THAN EVER!!!!!!!!!! Drink Specials are fabulous. Jessica the bartender is awesome. The New owners just Rock!!!! My husband has been going to this place since he turned 21, so for 25 years.

bitScujl00drH4Gs77L4Vg.text: So me and my buddy (coworker who is hourly) decide to go to lunch today.  What's the catch?  We don't know where to go.  We decided to go somewhere we haven't tried before that was off the beaten path. Enter Harvey's. Er, well, actually we did the entering.  We get into the place and it is a narrow bar with a line of tables to the right. We sit. We wait.  Finally, after much gab, the Waitress/Bartender comes up to our tables and says 'Hi' then proceeds to stare at us.  Anticipating the usual question 'Can I start you guys off with something to drink'  I order an RC cola and my buddy does the same.  She recommends the Cheeseburger so thats what we get.  I also ordered a mixed basket because (FOR SOME STRANGE REASON) fries aren't included with the burger! THIS IS AMERICA PEOPLE!!!!!  Along with the burger and fries, we got a lot of time to chat.  and I mean a LOT.  They sure are generous with time!!! Eventually, I ask her to put it in To Go containers and they give us the fries and cokes free.  Also, just a side note.  Please eat your food before coming on to Yelp and reading reviews about the food you are eating.  Some of these reviews almost made me vomit... almost.

photos.caption: Photo of Harvey's Wineburger - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Wineburger with Cheese w/ Mixed Basket

IuqMWwhWHTfXOSbENogYNA.text: What a great place! 8 of us met on a Tuesday night and couldn't have been happier. The food was good and the staff was attentive and very nice. Real nice place to hang out.

CHqKUBVGkq2_vxHmT6EGAA.text: Amazing onion rings and burgers to die for :) for a little hole in the wall restaurant there food is amazing! TRY THEIR PATTY MELT

oC3K5sdiwJ-oj3lR1HW38A.text: Great customer service at lunch. Order the lunch special and 6 other customers get served before me. Wait 45 minutes then get up to leave. Am asked "Do I want that to go?" Can anyone say @DirtyDrummer?

8RCSlmXeUORCqxZE7csQAg.text: Staff is amazingly friendly. Burgers are terrific, beer is cold and I could definitely see my self coming back.

hCGQkT6L_TEsjrZIkl98nw.text: We stopping in on Friday about 5:00 just to check it out. Harveys is a neighborhood dive. It felt like Cheers when we walked in. People at the bar (customers) said Hi and the waitress was right to us with menus and very friendly. OK, don't expect much in decor. The tables are sticky, like when the varnish is sticky and you can never get it clean enough to not be sticky. We had drinks very nice martinis. The bartender is a pro. I had a BLT, thin sliced bacon, crispy and just the right amount and my partner had a burger, both were excellent.  As we left the bar crew all said bye as well as the staff. I liked the folks there.

u-OcRuLhcw4OQMN9FbcuIQ.text: Don't let the dive bar interior put you off. Even as we walked in, a bar fight was about to happen, but that just added to the experience, right along with the sticky tables and low lighting. The waitress/bartender was really nice and both my mother and I got the burger and fries with sodas. The cook came over and asked us if we were sure we didn't want any add-ons so we just told her to throw some mushrooms on mom's and bacon on mine. She was a proper hole-in-the-wall fry cook with big hair. If laws didn't prohibit it, I have no doubt she'd have a cigarrette hanging from her lips. The food was a surprise. While extremely greasy (you're getting a burger and fries so never expect less), it was also extremely delicious. Perfecly seared, thick-patty burger (with a unique tartness from the wine) on fresh bread with nice thick-cut bacon and great fries. It came with some onions and lettuce to top, also fresh.  A perfect example to never judge a book by its cover. There's a reason this place has won some "best of" awards.

sZh-T8FwxK624V-QJfQorw.text: Best Dive in Phoenix. Good people & drinks.

WDcgetE8S0eyZkfJ5gBYfA.text: Now accepts plastic!  Now accepts plastic!  Did you hear me?  Harvey's now accepts plastic!  I've lived around the corner from Harvey's for a little over 4 years now.  I had lunch there once in the mid 1990's, and went in to watch a Suns playoff game a few years back when my friend was decked out in Spurs gear and we were nearly lynched at Half Moon.  Quick lunch with a girlfriend who was in the mood for a burger about a year ago.    While I love, and I do mean LOVE a good dive bar, this place scared the crap out of me.  I'm young, not hideous, female, and not of the meth-head variety - so not only did I not blend, but I felt targeted.  Sad, really.  The ONE bar within easy drunk stumbling distance from my house, and I wasn't happy going there.  During a weekday for lunch was more or less okay.  But evenings are when the freaks come out.  And I don't mean the freaks like me.  I mean the dangerous crazy ones - not just the fun crazy ones.  There's a difference!  Well, enter the new roommate.  He was disinclined to believe my review, and insisted we go.  I resisted until late Saturday night, when he came home at 1am and insisted I get dressed so we could go there for an hour.  Maybe I was tired.  Maybe I needed a change of pace.  Whatever the reason, I gave in, got dressed and we walked over to Harvey's.  YAY!  According to Echo, the bartender (yes, it's her real name.  her parents are hippies like mine), the owner has been working hard to improve the place (read: clientele) for over a year.  It shows!    Echo is three shades of awesome - the perfect gal to be running the bar!  Easy smile, quick wit, great sense of humor and the talent to mix a great drink while cooking any of the grub from the menu.  She is a one woman show and pulls it off like a champ!  June drink specials included $2.00 Beam 5 Star bourbon, Yukon Jack, and I don't remember what else.  I asked for a bourbon and coke, the roommate asked for his bourbon neat.  (Brave - cheap bourbon *needs* to be cut with something!).  The pour is solid and consistent  Oh, and did I mention you can get a mixed drink, anytime day or night for just two bucks?  For $2!! Two drinks for me, two shots for him, a beer chaser for him and a cheese wineburger split between us.  Under $14!!  Holy hell, it's cheaper to drink here than it is at home!  And at home - we don't have the entertainment of the other patrons.  Like Cowboy who would do the splits on demand.  And suggest my roommate go through the needed steps for a game of "rodeo" with his girlfriend. You just can't make this up! Oh - and he bestowed slightly drunk me with a new nickname. Apparently, I am a "prick ass bitch."  I don't know how he meant it, but I am taking it as a compliment and will wear it with pride!  Oh, yes.  I will certainly be back!  A LOT.

OvcNlbtzQ31HVGOKFOmnCg.text: Would have given a 4 star if the service were more prompt with a bit more attention to detail. Burgers are good, especially the Spicy burger, and the Jalapeno Bottlecaps were my favorite among the appetizers. I'm thinking the bartenders were too tired after Happy Hour. Want to come back at a less busy time.

PC04ebxzg_TKFLupwy0A2g.text: Best burgers, fries, onion rings I've had in years! Must go! Delicious and cheap, cant be beat!

bRhIXcwtt_Ofn6XlEn1Xhw.text: This is the best dive bar in Phoenix.      Not the diveyest,   the best.    It's not the "scary" or "rough" sort of joint,  I never feel even the slightest bit unsafe here, nor worried about my car outside.   If you're not into laughing, being positive and casual and openly social with everyone at a dive bar,    this place won't be good for you and you won't be good for it.      Take your negativity somewhere else.   At Harvey's you can look like you just rolled out of bed or dressed up,  whatever, doesn't matter.     All that matters is everyone's there to be happy,  be themselves,  be friends.      As for the food?     The burgers are unpretentious and have no real gimmicks,  you order a burger and it shows up and it's just an honest delicious  burger,  not too much salt or seasoning so you can taste the  meat, the lettuce, the onion for exactly what they are - PERFECT!    Update:  I invited my brother in law here,  and he refused because he says the wings are awful.    Well,  simple solution:  don't come here for wings.    It's Harvey's WineBURGER.     I'm not a wing person so I don't know first hand how their wings are.    Some other reviewers also said their wings suck so let's just go with that.

7LYwsaW-fUvGujsxCjfp4w.text: Great little dive with cheap drinks. The Burgers are one of my favorite in the Valley!

jiJW4VivydfF8_GGQYACbw.text: Love this place. The burgers are the best in Phoenix and the staff is on point. Mark deserves a raise!!!

JzyXzcLcdIFWjOeeRDw8Dg.text: This was my first time here. I got the Tuesday special, , and then I checked in and received an additional 10% off. They get points just based off that, a lot of places have stipulations to the "check in" discount.   On to the food, I got that wine cheeseburger it was amazing. I got my bread extra toasted. It was fresh and huge, it came with fries, all for $6. Definitely a win win.   I will be back for sure.

cDjpaDrX5YTwsRfGgSAa-g.text: Here's the thing: I love dive bars.   This place is IT.   Tiny lil dirty, cozy bar. Pool tables, darts, sport ball games on tv, great tunes on the jukebox, friendly bartenders. We watch our Wineburgers get tossed onto the griddle, along with a giant pile of onions, getting slow cooked with wine while we sip on cheap beers in ice cold glasses.   Don't get the Super Delux Wineburger unless you're REALLY hungry. These burgers are hearty. Especially since they come with fries. And you know you're getting a drink or two. Onion rings are pretty alright, so get those if you're still hungry.  We came in on Friday night and got to watch the adorable cook dance and sing to Bruno Mars blasting on the jukebox. You should come for this alone. Such a great atmosphere. I'll definitely be back for happy hour or late night shenanigans.  Personal sidenote: I told my mom I came here and, like everything else I think I've had a first experience at, she very calmly informed me that I've already been when I was young. I love my parents. Bringing kids to bars since the 90s. No shame.

1HmflGRxowzHhNxMIAzkYA.text: Are you a fan of dive bars? Do you love a juicy burger for under $10? Drink specials for $3?Welp, then Harvey's Wineburger is your spot! I have heard about this place for years! Like i'm pretty sure my dad went here in college. Don't expect anything fancy - this is a dive with greasy "bar food"and cheap drinks. What is not to love?  We popped in here around 8:30p on a Thursday night and could not wait to try one of their famous burgers! I ordered the cheese Wineburger with American cheese and mushrooms. YUM doesn't even describe the goodness of this burger - it was super juicy and literally melted in my mouth. Not to mention, IT WAS HUGE anddddd....I ate it all! {#noshame}. It was under $10 and worth every penny. The best part, all of their Svedka vodka drinks were only $3!!! Yes, $3!! They even had cucumber! Um, yes please! They also have daily specials that are a steal - $6.50 for an entire meal, can't beat that! My husband and I walked out with 2 meals and 2 cocktails for under $25.   We left SUPER full and satisfied. It was just what the doctor ordered after a long day of traveling and delayed flights. The service was also very friendly. We'll be back again for sure!

yAl8wgn8OmBkfCZvzbWB6w.text: Cheers semi-dive bar indeed but also a sports bar or is it a burger pit??? Actually its all three rolled into one very quaint but a total relic. It's been here as long as I can remember and unfortunately this is my first stop. While Phoenix continues to grow there are a few oldie but goodie stops this one included. It's now made it to my top list of favorite places to eat.   Every night there is an amazingly priced special and where can you eat a meal for around $10 bucks!  First, I'd like to mention by no means am I a burger connoisseur. Truth is...I'm not into eating burgers but hands down this was the best patty melt I've had in a while! They went old school style with rye bread and this place actually makes burgers from fresh hamburger not some pre-made patty. I ordered my burger medium rare and it came exactly as such! Shoot, I can't even do that at home!   We arrived and only a few patrons saddled up to the bar. It seemed like they all knew each other, a bit of an eclectic non-pretentious group. There were a few pool tables and a small dinning area. The bartender/server greeted us immediately and within a few minutes got us our drink order.   Shortly after we arrived the place filled up and without hesitation the bartender was doing loops around the entire place without skipping a beat. Made my head spin really just watching her. Big kudos to her and to the cook!   Everyone must go at least to try the patty melt if nothing these! And if you want to catch a game, there are enough TVs to go around for about 1 per person - no kidding!   Cheers!

pBpvypkAWxNRHAm6Gbgyvg.text: I was at the end of a 30 day challenge that was focused on avoiding certain foods: candy, soda, ice cream, white bread, and burgers to name a few. Needless to say, at the end of this nightmare I wanted the best burger my city had to offer. I did a little research and stumbled across Harvey's. Do not be deceived by the dumpy exterior, this place is great! Food is amazing, staff was incredible, and the bill was tiny at the end of it all. Keep up the good work.

jHvodbGv77uISkJrkEWfUw.text: Terrific burgers made as you order and as you desire it cooked. Totally bar and beer environment, but a great place to chill with a couple of friends or family over a juicy burger and a drink

photos.caption: Photo of Harvey's Wineburger - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Great burgers and fun friends in a small group

Cb--uIMkUajEHdTB9Is0hA.text: Had a great night hanging out with friends! Very accommodating for my friend Sara's birthday! Patti was a great bartender!  Will definitely be back!

3UeLR-5kpxB1sKYs-zwLfw.text: Great burgers. Way better than the zin zen bs. Plus great atmosphere and service. Lots of good beer served in ice cold glasses always helps too.

Sq5ZrHRJtywUZy7w0g2FkA.text: This place is a super cute dive bar..... The decor is fabulous and I was excited to eat here. The husband and I started by ordering drinks..... Unfortunately, my drink never came.... And the service was so spotty, it became irrelevant by the time I could have asked for it. The husband got a wine cheeseburger and I got their version of a patty melt with bacon and parm sauce.... My burger was pretty not awesome. The bottom piece of bread was soggy with grease. The bacon was thin. The cheese didn't taste like cheese..... Tasted processed. Overall, the burger was super disappointing and left a slick of grease in my mouth. The fries, however, were awesome. Perfectly fried and crispy. The husband's burger was better than mine. It was a pretty standard burger. I feel like there are better places to get burgers in the valley that cost the same or less.

IJ5N-0So7Tf7Ljp28G_rmQ.text: Currently in the TOP 3 burgers we have reviewed in the Phoenix Metro area. You can see our full video burger review here: youtu.be/-4wDm3fAEXQ

t6CralcrR__8YJd6Hoqwgg.text: Hidden burger joint... if you want a good burger but don't want the price tag or to have to get ready, this is the spot! We stopped by in sweatpants and an appetite, left very content. It has a diverse crowd, as expected in the area, which we love the most!

Y6rOPqNBIekRHP0WBdXz7A.text: Very tasty burger, cold beer and good service. Went there with a group of friends and had a good time. People having a good time, no riff raff, will definitely go back. Wish I lived closer. Bartender with a beard was personable and gave great service.

6aP899uHwRMKeglxEf9ARw.text: Great Food, Great Prices, and Awesome Happy Hour! Place is small and quaint! Friendly staff and great service!

ePK01V5ZejJHR5A-0r_lNA.text: Went to check it out.  The daily special was the cheeseburger and fries and we had the jalapeno caps. They were interesting. Food was ok.  Music was really loud.  Staff was awesome.

-MdtcY3R-hmBMyHZZcghQw.text: Standard dive bar....minimal decor, regular crowd, sports on tv, cheap drinks ($2.50 wells and $2.75 bottled beer during happy hour).  BUT they have the wineburger! It's delicious, it's cheap, and it's a phoenix classic.  Highly recommend stopping in once in a while for anyone in the area.  And kids are welcome!

PIryxOVDTGDf5A9h-25smQ.text: If you want oh so gooey good!  I am so happy I had the spice burger with onion rings!  We had great service and awesome food. Music a little louder then I like but, it's a bar. I haven't been here in at least 40 years, why?  I will be back again.

ISYiEO094_NYwmljkpKqIw.text: First experience at Harvey's and I ordered a pepper-jack cheese wineburger. Great lighting and my meal was cooked in a timely and welcoming fashion. Would recommend, nice vibe

qz7YxOhVOZNzigDWLBmv8Q.text: Great little dive near the Biltmore. Some of the best burgers I've ever had, though they removed my favorite from the menu (oh please bring back the saucy burger, I need that A1 laddled bacon covered deliciousness in my life).   They have two pool tables and a machine to despense quarters, and you can order from either the bar or from the billiards side and they'll even deliver to your table. Their drink prices are a bit higher than other dives near by and their burger prices are a bit steep but for $10 you are getting a huge burger! And definitely try their garlic sauce, it goes great on everything.  Perfect casual place to bring a friend visiting from out of town or coworkers after a long shift, it does get quite busy and there's no smoking patio but ample parking and I've never had a problem finding a seat. Their pool tables aren't emaculate but their cues are in good repair and they have many to choose from. They even do a Sunday pool league. They also offer a burger of the day from their menu so you can save a few bucks by coming in on your favorite's day!  The clientele range from the usual rowdy day drinkers to more hipster PBR fans but everyone has always been friendly and talkative.

PM_XsDZRa-lm2jVS7MhsCA.text: Had lunch there today , Adrianne, our bartender was not only friendly but makes an awesome cocktail. Super nice And welcoming . Our food was delicious ! After our lunch she suggested a yum shot with pickle juice back up! Loved it!!! Will be coming back next  weds afternoon!

QAFGkdsn33c2y0XwCV_NQQ.text: So yummy! I recommend the Rodeo Burger however Joshua Mylo had the Mushroom Swiss Burger. Service was awesome very hospitable & friendly. Happy Hour midday Sunday!!

PPv0fHuzDtQ3Z2U9dNtG_Q.text: Just want people to know this place has the best burgers in town. The staff is great and the people are friendly, very accommodating for group get togethers it's awesome to see the owner step up and make this place even better. If you are looking for a good time at  wonderful price this place is for you.

yK1GFULzFv6BvUmLsetSMA.text: Know what you're in for when you walk in and sit down. Here's what Harvey's has going for it:  I'm a big fan of their food, especially the Patty Melt. I've also had their burgers and chicken strips and, although it's nothing groundbreaking and innovative, it's better than a lot of places that try to get fancy with it. It's a classic for a reason, leave it the hell alone.  The drinks are also awesome. Prices are about what you'd expect and are pretty decently discounted during happy hour and for their daily specials. I don't even know what they are off the top of my head, but that's what the internets are for, figure it out yourself, I'm not on the take.  Ultimately though, the reason I frequent this place and continue to go back is because it's chill, the staff is super friendly, and the patrons are generally not a loud, jackass-ish sort of crowd. Want to stop by for a drink with a few friends after work and not have to deal with a bunch of bullshit? Harvey's is for you. Also and maybe it's because I suffered through Scottsdale bars for a year (I'm not rich and/or good looking), but the staff has always seemed... normal. Yeah they're at work, but they'll shoot the shit with you and laugh at a stupid joke and sometimes offer one of their own. It's almost like this place is run by humans instead of booze dispensing automatons.  Oh and pool tables and darts are there too if you're into that sort of thing.

fMFvT63K5RUhQ0INuJuH-Q.text: Let me say this, I have searched my entire life for a burger as delicious as the one I recently enjoyed at Harvey's Wineburger.  This burger had more flavor than any that I have ever tasted in my entire life.  I had the garlic patty melt, with a side of onion rings.  The patty melt included this amazing garlic parmesan sauce, along with the crispiest bacon I have seen.  The only potential drawback to their burgers is that they are so juicy that they are messy and soak through the bun.  However, that does not matter to me because the flavor was unreal.  My only regret is that I have lived in Phoenix for 13 years and this was the first time I visited. Needless to say, this will not be the last. This has now become my go-to restaurant that I will be taking out of town visiters to.

kN1WdjQfMbJA9Oxll0FWqg.text: It's a dive bar with cheap drinks, pool tables, and some decent food. It doesn't try to sell you on anything it's not and delivers well on what it is!

C81_8kBcx5ogXpGtqeePjw.text: Great neighborhood bar! Amazing burgers and great drinks. Service is fast and friendly. I'd highly recommend

x3X_Ne7Ewy29XHAjfnfu_g.text: The burgers are really good but the service was wack. The bartender was acting like he didn't want to serve me and took a while to take my order. I probably won't go back

68DJ28HMTvSqDEfUk0Gf-g.text: The burgers are really good and always fresh, never frozen. You can tell they use good quality ground beef. 504FJmSDx7E-2RJ7eKNsdg.text: Finally stopped by here after years of driving by it. The reason for the stop was we were looking for a place to throw darts and grab a bite to eat so this popped up as an option. First thing I want to highlight is the dart board. It looks brand new and works like a champ. Best one I've thrown at in awhile. Second, the happy hour doesn't sound great (50 cents off), but because the drinks are already so cheap it's a great deal. As for food we ordered a cheeseburger + green chili. The burger was juicy and good. The chili was canned chili and mild so nothing special. We also tried the sampler platter. The chicken strips were actually really good, the jalapeno bottle caps were salty, and the mozzarella sticks were pretty straight forward. We enjoyed our visit and will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Harvey's Wineburger - Phoenix, AZ, United States. I ate my food before a pick so here you go yelp!  The cheese wineburger was the best!

HkrlMLOutxA6xeF_GjhPCg.text: Did this place change hands or something?  This has always (for over a decade) been my go-to for a burger and a drink. I came in today and the woman cooking the burgers is as slow as can be - more interested in visiting with her buddies at the bar about personal stuff than actually doing her job and making some burgers. The drink tasted like an airline drink, not the usual quality that I have come to know. Seems like they are resting on their laurels and depending on increased business from new apartments and not providing the quality service, food and drink I've come to know. It's very disappointing.

XKiRu7awIonxXo9jfZ_LHg.text: Fries were meh. The burger itself was pretty good, nice & juicy. The prices were beyond reasonable. They have daily specials too if you can't make happy hour. Only paid $6.50 for a cheese wine burger and fries (Tuesday's). The service was very pleasant and friendly.

2yu1atVT74rspCryUZ_z0A.text: I had not been here in years. The burgers are still the best. Totally fun little hole in the wall place that you do not want to miss.

bdAdK8cx9_2EgdXx5F1wGQ.text: I've said it before and I'll say it again, this place is fanfuckingtastic! The wine burgers are perfect and delicious.  The place is divey but not so divey that you'll get stabbed in the parking lot after dark. Staff is super friendly and I've never waited long even when the place is packed. I wish they'd franchise these. I'd open them everywhere.

WKMWP_S_-6zIvBszAdrOUw.text: Might just be the best burger in town..Not a very big place,but it packs a punch. Lots of TV's,beer ,wings and socializing.My burger was pretty plump. FXbovJOZPuCf1uXQoeUWZw.text: First and foremost, this is bar food and that's what I'm comparing to. I had the garlic melt which was pretty damn good. Fries were just okay. Would have preferred crisp shoestring fries. Service was exceptional. Want a good burger, here ya' go.

8U_mqNNMwqpCAfFb6QtDfQ.text: Don't come here expecting fast or on point service. That being said, it's a dive bar, don't set your sights too high there. Ambiance is fantastic! Food is CHEAP and DELICIOUS. Music coming from the juke box is fun and sounds great. I can't wait to come back.

voEL9EID8bxNVTMdJqxFrg.text: If you enjoy a good divey dark bar this place is great. It's got a great small local bar feel. The bartender was awesome. Loved her! lXCywk1o9xyVYiIN20V6lA.text: If you're looking for a great spot to have a burger, this is definitely a great place to go. For the price I paid, I was amazed on how good the burger was for the price I paid - and it was homemade! You can tell the meat was never frozen. You can tell they made it the way your dad would! I love the food, but probably would not go back as I don't feel the most comfortable. I suppose that's what a dive bar is, but I feel they could do more to attract different crowds.

UN2juule934ICUCAwzee0A.text: This place is classic Burger Heaven!!! Know that there are no salads or healthy food- this is bar food at its very best! The establishment is clean and the staff is beyond friendly. We always feel welcome here with our service dog Little Sushi. They care about customers and customer service.   The food! Best burger in town! They have fried jalapenos and they are addictive. My husband and I always get the super deluxe burger and it's not only tasty it's affordable- always a bonus! The bar is fully stocked and offers a great many choices to keep you hydrated ;)   This is a phoenix staple - it's historic but not only that - they are a great establishment with amazing food and service that deserves recognition 100% if you love burgers you need to have this place in your life. :)

uw5leQoKh732wNLcf3ZT_A.text: Great Dive bar. Super friendly staff n very tasty burger. Good music, pool and darts. Historic... in business over 60 years. Will return for sure.

ptJNm-QfaW1LiVF_8FoHog.text: These burgers are the best!!!!! Haven't eaten here for years since I live 90 miles away. I may be making some trips just for lunch...... and can't forget about the help, you guys are great.

aPs8wpuBYq5LUb2LUawPEA.text: The burgers here were great. Much like a burger that you would cook at a BBQ. Thick and juicy. Its an old run down bar, limited amount of seating and tables are pretty close together. It was clean inside but had that old bar feel. The service is not terrible but it wasnt the best either. One of the burgers was undercooked which the cook happily no questions asked cooked another one for us. Kudos to the cook.  The fries were good and went amazing with the burger. It was priced decently as well. You would spend just as much if you went to Jack In The Box but you would get a fresher and better burger.  I could only eat half the burger and I was full. The meat was great, nothing bad to say there. Its not a must to stop in, but if your a stickler for a thick juicy burger, this may fill that void!

x0BRtL2fnAE5WT7S7Z7THA.text: Great dive bar, saying that they always have drink and shot specials. Their burgers are above average for a restaurant let alone dive bar food.. D6Ph5ACOz9StA5kZCN6JAA.text: Just to be weird, I have only gone here for lunch. With Groupons.  All I can say is that a) the burgers are good b) it's so blatantly anti-yuppie that its actually appealing, and c) I need a leisure suit and a mid-70's Dodge to do this place right.

x6S0wKk8P01fGDOj-36Big.text: About two years ago I was out here for work and I stop in here maybe by change maybe because I saw a Yelp review, but we can go for the second.  This is a total dive bar.  They have these small pitchers for when you want two beer but dont want to come back up so often.  But even better than the food and drinks, they have Duck pin bowling.  It is like a small single lane bowling alley right in the bar and it is the great bar game ever.  I was staying 45 minutes away in North Scottsdale last time I was in town and drove here just for a beer a couple quick games.  It sounds odd, but so much fun.

FcqTXZb_b-iVLEgJDwqjJg.text: This place is after my heart.   1. Dive bar  Reasonable priced drinks, specials always available, low key atmosphere. Only thing I would change is maybe turn down the volume on the music a bit (especially when the pop music gets a bit out of control) and fix the thermostat so its consistent and not extreme in both rooms. Those two things fixed and it would easily be 5 stars.  2. My favorite burger in town  UHMAZING WINEBURGERS. I didn't even know wineburgers existed until I moved here. Thank god I moved here. Now, keep in context what this place is and is not. It's not a gourmet burger joint. It's not extremely creative burgers with the best there is in ingredients. IT IS a dang amazing, done right every time burger. Nothing flashy, nothing fancy, just good eats. Not to mention, when they run out of burgers (which happens) the rest of the menu is well worth checking out.  3. Pool tables  Fun past time and offers a little activity while slinging beers and noming the night away. Just a past-time I personally enjoy. :)  4. Fantastic staff  Friendly, yet not fake. They'll have a good laugh with you and banter. They know what they're doing and the service is good.

UaxyVhUQkFiv2e4M36TZxw.text: Great burger for the price. Always friendly service. One of the oldest burger spots in town!

gnAigO-nxiRN3zRgjFxQnA.text: Would have given a five star but the $3 salad was the worst. It was just a bowl of lettuce and some chopped tomatoes. Onion rings awesome perfectly cooked. Cheeseburger great flavor. Awesome fireball shot $4.50 but $3.00 on Monday.

sF-sjz_0D5c1oOX-dS5Niw.text: They've changed hands again.  I'd been going there fairly regularly for something like 20 years.  The guy who started it (Harvey, I presume) ran it for around 40 years, until he died.  His daughter ran it for another five years (about) but decided running a dive bar wasn't what she wanted to do with her life and put it up for sale.  It was bought by a Vietnamese couple who upgraded the interior.  They added a bunch of big flat screen TVs, started taking credit cards.  The place used to be cash only, although they did put in an ATM a couple years back.  Harvey's signature was the wineburger, hand formed from quality beef.  Always excellent,  But the new owners switched out for preformed patties of cheaper meat.  That was a spoiler for me.  And apparently not only me.  The last time I went there under those owners I was the only one there.  I wonder why they couldn't figure out where their crowd had gone.  I ordered a hot dog.  But apparently those owners dumped the place as a loser (said the bartender).  I went there last week.  Whomever bought it brought back the first class meat (98%) with fresh, hand made patties.  It's back on my recommended list.  What other people say about the ambiance is True.  It =is= a dive bar.  I mean that in the best sense.  Cheap drinks, a friendly crowd (many of whom seem to be regulars; they know each other).

u2bvH2RuqV_IhO-2w3_O7g.text: Top 5 burger In Phoenix for the price. I always get the patty melt, best I have ever had. Been going here for years the environment inside sometimes unnecessarily loud from the jukebox. Burger is always on point though and will satisfy your burger fix.

_p_z-k6ijIcFJSIuTaVPDw.text: Been a while since first review but this a 5 star burger joint.  Simply great.  Hard to out do!  Come see for yourself!!!

ZdN0iSzLcV7sdHcYRTMxNQ.text: Fun place and really good burgers

cCIeAtNpLItJwSr0ZzzhDQ.text: Not a  local. Just saw it was close by when I was hungry thanks to Yelp. Pulled in lot and was concerned because looked like abandoned crack warehouse. But once inside a great dive type bar with pretty and friendly servers. Beer cold. Food good. Me like.

gfttwv-S7B3pTJcBfHmsxg.text: The first time I came here it was really good. I got a burger because that's what they're known for and it was delicious. Maybe being a little tipsy might have something to do with it.  My boyfriend hated the place. He hated the food and hated the server. She wasn't attentive at all. The wings were chewy,  which means they deep fried frozen wings. I tried to tell him he was being very critical.        The next time I went there, I was there with a friend and sans boyfriend. After a bit of drinking I decided it was time to go home. Earlier I convinced my boyfriend to give them another chance in the food department and picked us up some food to-go, burgers because they were so good. I live within walking distance from the place and when I got home, i noticed the burgers were practically raw. I called the bar and told them what happened, and they ask me to come back so they could replace my food. My boyfriend wanted no part of that, and wanted a refund for his food. After the bartender assured me that my food will be cooked properly I came in and picked up my replacement food. He was also good enough to refund me a couple of my drinks from earlie which made up for the hassle. That burger he cooked himself and it was good. He also took the lady who made my burger off the grill.      Today I went there and picked up some food to go. The same lady who cooked my burger before, was working the grill. I didn't want to be a dick and ask for someone else to cook it and I decided to give her another chance. Before I left the bar, I checked my burger to make sure it was cooked all the way, and again it was raw. So I asked the server to have her cook it a little longer, and when I got home it was ok but then my fries were cold. All in all, it's a pain in the ass to try to get food cooked properly there. If you like rare hamburgers, this will be the place for you.

UybEl0Ljp97OVo6ODP0ATQ.text: Would come more often if staff were nicer. They seem annoyed by my presence but I do like the food.

cmduOLvRJVryljT6ZXpv5A.text: I love this place. Its a great, chill place to go. All the bartenders are super friendly and I never have to wait to get a drink, shot or food. znzfHrJWZ70q9NBsP1r44Q.text: Great cheap burgers Fantastic people watching Sit at the bar to watch them cook and to mingle with the crazy regulars Game room with pool table and pin bowling. Great place to watch a game Get grilled onions on your burger

photos.caption: Photo of Harvey's Wineburger - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cheese wine burger with fries and Kiltlifter.

Check the drink specials, can't beat their PBR & shot special.  The staff is awesome!!

ur_TH9sJQWsxU4Ea1igj1Q.text: Our server was friendly but didn't hover. I loved their mushroom and Swiss and burger and my husband raved about their Wineburger. This could easily be my favorite burger ever. Onion rings and fries were good, too. Super cheap prices. Definitely a dive so I'm not sure I'd take really little kids, but the food is amazing.

yKc0_EOyFKITh3pVU24Huw.text: This was the ideal place for me to go to that Sunday late afternoon when I felt like having a good cheeseburger AND watching the Pats and the Chiefs to see who'd be going to the Superbowl. The Central Corridor of Phoenix has no shortage of bars for game watching and bar food, but this one probably has the most relaxed, casual neighborhood "old bar" look and feel in the area. I walked in and ordered a cheeseburger, onion rings, and beer; the folks at the bar were very friendly and accommodating. I sat down at one of the small tables in the pool table area because it was more quiet there and it was easier to view the game on the screens in that room. The burger was very good - juicy, well-seasoned, cooked exactly as I ordered it; and the onion rings were the best I've had in the city ... I have to remember to ask for two orders next time! I had a pretty good time and had only two things to grouse about: it took a long time to get my food, and the Chiefs lost the game.

DgiNRDL_x3zAPoJAqeHC4g.text: Sometimes a gal needs some late night food, and when you're in a pinch, Harvey's Wineburger is a solid late night place to end up for some middle of the night grub.    Harvey's has a cool, dive bar type feel with the added bonus of a kitchen that grills up burgers.  We got 2 cheese wineburgers (cooked medium rare) with pepper jack cheese, jalapenos and a side of fries. Burgers were juicy, fries were crispy, and it was exactly what we needed to satiate our late night bellies.   Pro Tip: kitchen is open until 1pm, so if you're hungry get in before the kitchen shuts down for the night!    There were also tv's displayed around so we watched some games on the screen, and there looked like there was a pool table on the other side of the bar, so we'll be checking that out next time.  I'll definitely be coming back to Harvey's next time I'm looking for some late night grub!

aJO3f3KI_IzuhCzgl_NiBQ.text: Been to Harvey's a few times with my friend's, playing pool and enjoying a few cold ones. The bartenders are top  shelf! Went there last night to celebrate a friend's birthday and everyone recommended that I try one of Harvey's famous burgers. I ordered the Swiss mushroom burger. When the order came I noticed that the Swiss cheese was processed cheese and the mushrooms came from a can. Couldn't even eat it.  I finished off my beer and waited approximately 30 minutes for the waitress to come back and she never did. Finally one of my friends went to the bar to get me another beer. The table next to me was served 5 more rounds of beer without our several tables being checked on or cleaned up. Had to go to the bar to pay my tab and then I left.

RkSxMy3jtiGIuYy7NeLM3g.text: One of the best burgers I have had. Do yourself a favor and add the garlic parmesan sauce to your burger... so good!   Staff was super friendly and attentive. Already planning when to go back.

tpk9hfB-YIF-Zh73_O-Ufg.text: Well this review is long over due. How do I know? Because I just earned the "You're a Regular" badge, which means my inebriated self has more than likely checked in several times now.   Anywhoooo - let's get down to facts.  1. Harvey's is great. 2. Glorified divey bar. (Glorified because they're not fully divey since they have some sazerac whiskeys on their back bar along with other good spirits but still has that divey feel. It's aaaaaaawesome) 3. Ask for Mark. He's awesome. 4. Once you've asked for Mark, ask Mark about the garlic parmesan mixed with buffalo sauce wings that are to die for. 5. Order the garlic patty melt. 6. Get yourself an uber when the night is over  Loyal customer :)

QWdMTuH1tO3XS3QvFvno4A.text: AMAZING BURGERS!!!!  The food was great. The help was just as good.  The pricing was very good. Hole in the wall joint with a smashing burger.   I recommend to everyone.

ixLKaj-Yt7uZEJZ5neTXoQ.text: Place is amazing! Burgers and wings are our go to meals. cheap drinks and friendly staff. Been coming here for a couple of years now and it's always great!

puctvsF8eNDXdH-pFfW1cw.text: If you know me, you know the way to my heart is through a good dive bar. Harvey's is a pretty good one of those. PBR holds a special place in my heart, from my college days and I don't care if you make fun of me, I actually like the way it tastes. You can get a tall boy for like 2 dollars at Harvey's.   I also really enjoy the food, they have weekly burger deals-which are worth it. I've had the classic wine burger-with cheese, the patty melt, and the chicken one. Don't get the chicken one, it isn't very good. I think it's just on the menu to have that option, but it tastes bland and like it came from frozen.   The good news is, the other burgers are pretty spot on. I love the patty melt, it's open goey glory. The wine burger is flavourful and moist. The fries are pretty good too. I will say, there has been some inconsistency, it depends who is cooking. The guy with the beard does a great job. For the price though, and the excellent divey atmosphere, this place is   I went here and waited 1:30 minutes for my food. We asked for water 3 times and never got them. This is terrible. I don't want to come back anymore

iW0KgOS-o5UPD6C_rpYb3g.text: Best damn patty melt ever.  Place is super friendly with a green Shape of Water movie lighting theme.  The soda glasses are the red ones I use to see at Midwest steakhouses.   Crowd is crunchy friendly and eclectic.  My patty melt was on real rye bread and the meat was not the frozen brick but real ground beef.  The onions were the perfect amount and the cheese was super yummy.  They also have daily burger specials and the onion rings taste hand made.    I'm eager to swing back to this tasty nearby dive soon.   Really soon!

tFQR-11iSn2OsBB-bmH-fw.text: The fries: to die for.  There again, in mass quantities, they might do the same to you.  A wonderful sudsy lair, with 50 years of flavor on the grill.  Have them hard sear your burger and you will be rewarded, because it is all about the juices.

tDhA7SQLKkj3wT_ix_x06Q.text: I had the pleasure of eating here last night. I ordered the Deluxe burger cooked medium rare and I will say it was probably one of the best burgers I have had in a while. I ordered it medium rare and the party was huge and they cooked it just right. At first I was hesitant of eating here because it reminded me of a old broken down strip club, but I'm glad I ate here because I will be going there again. The service is amazing and the ppl there are very welcoming. One thing I did notice is that when I ordered my burger I added mushrooms on it. When they brought my burger out they had placed the melted cheese on top of the mushrooms so that the mushrooms wouldn't fall out after the first bite. Not a lot of places do this and I thought it was thoughtful and surprised. Oh more more thing. They have been open since 1958! WOW!!!

5lmMZfqLKMgyB3WMmtDb5w.text: Great place with super friendly staff.  Don't let the outside fool you, its bigger than you think! I have the Original wine burger cooked medium and a 16oz can of PBR (or 3) with fries.  Everything was good and the prices were fantastic! I'd recommend a visit if you're in the area and craving a burger that isn't comercially made.

k3kbNQnyBy1TaGcJOjotng.text: I just love Harvey's!  My wife and I go at least once a week, usually a few times. 3Jf-Y96i-0ZViUz83TMYRg.text: Best place I've been to in Phoenix by far! I love their food & atmosphere l! If you're looking for a great place to hangout with good food and people this is the place for you and friends check it out!
